item.title: Cybersecurity M&A Roundup: 40 Deals Announced in September 2025
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Significant cybersecurity M&A deals announced by Check Point, CrowdStrike, F5, Mitsubishi Electric, and SentinelOne. 

The post Cybersecurity M&A Roundup: 40 Deals Announced in September 2025 appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Filigran Raises $58 Million in Series C Funding
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
The company plans to expand to new markets, fuel the development of a new module for its platform, and accelerate AI integration.

The post Filigran Raises $58 Million in Series C Funding appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Security Firm Exposes Role of Beijing Research Institute in China’s Cyber Operations
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
BIETA and its subsidiary CIII research develop and sell technologies supporting China’s intelligence, counterintelligence, and military operations.

The post Security Firm Exposes Role of Beijing Research Institute in China’s Cyber Operations appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Fortra GoAnywhere MFT Zero-Day Exploited in Ransomware Attacks
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
The Medusa ransomware operators exploited the GoAnywhere MFT vulnerability one week before patches were released.

The post Fortra GoAnywhere MFT Zero-Day Exploited in Ransomware Attacks appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: The Y2K38 Bug Is a Vulnerability, Not Just a Date Problem, Researchers Warn
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
The Year 2036/2038 problem is a bug that will be triggered in more than a decade, but hackers could exploit it today against ICS and consumer devices.

The post The Y2K38 Bug Is a Vulnerability, Not Just a Date Problem, Researchers Warn appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Critical Vulnerability Puts 60,000 Redis Servers at Risk of Exploitation
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Authenticated attackers can exploit the security flaw to trigger a use-after-free and potentially execute arbitrary code.

The post Critical Vulnerability Puts 60,000 Redis Servers at Risk of Exploitation appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Discord Says User Information Stolen in Third-Party Data Breach
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Names, usernames, email addresses, contact information, IP addresses, and billing information was compromised.

The post Discord Says User Information Stolen in Third-Party Data Breach appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Microsoft and Steam Take Action as Unity Vulnerability Puts Games at Risk
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
The flaw could lead to local code execution, allowing attackers to access confidential information on devices running Unity-built applications.

The post Microsoft and Steam Take Action as Unity Vulnerability Puts Games at Risk appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Hackers Extorting Salesforce After Stealing Data From Dozens of Customers
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Salesforce says the extortion attempts are related to past or unsubstantiated incidents, and not to fresh intrusions.

The post Hackers Extorting Salesforce After Stealing Data From Dozens of Customers appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Data Breach at Doctors Imaging Group Impacts 171,000 People
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Doctors Imaging Group is informing customers about a cybersecurity incident nearly a year after it occurred. 

The post Data Breach at Doctors Imaging Group Impacts 171,000 People appeared first on SecurityWeek.
